data.name: Helles
data.description: It takes finesse to brew a light beer that is really full of flavor. This seemingly simple elegance is reflected in our newest seasonal offering, Helles. German pilsner malt gives subtle malt sweetness while Hallertau Tradition hops provide the enticing aroma of this classic style. A dry finish, with moderate bitterness, makes this a true session beer.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Münchner (Munich)-Style Helles
style.description: This beer should be perceived as having low bitterness. It is a medium-bodied, malt-emphasized beer with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). Certain renditions of this beer style have  a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. Malt character is sometimes bread-like yet always reminiscent of freshly and very lightly toasted malted barley. There should not be any caramel character. Color is light straw to golden. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze.

breweries.name: Real Ale Brewing Company
breweries.description: Welcome to the Texas Hill Country - the home of Real Ale Brewing Company, where a dedicated team of brewers produces quality handcrafted ales. Utilizing a 60-barrel stainless steel brewing system, we incorporate 100% malted grain, domestic and imported hops, and crystal clear water into our unique recipes. We've been brewing since 1996, and now you can find Real Ale all over the Lone Star State. If you don't see us at your favorite stores, bars, and restaurants, make sure to ask for us by name! Cheers and thanks for your support!

breweries.name: Widmer Brothers Brewing
breweries.description:
Widmer Brothers Brewing is located in beautiful and brew-friendly Portland, OR. Our publicly-held brewery employs over 150 people who are as passionate about quality craft beer as Kurt & Rob themselves.

We opened the brewery in 1984, and built a new 40-barrel brewing system in our current Russell Street location in 1990. We've grown steadily ever since. In 1996, we completed installation of a state-of-the art 250-barrel brewhouse, bringing our capacity to 220,000 barrels per year. In 1996, for the first time in our brewery’s history we also installed a bottling line, capable of producing 500 bottles per minute. In 2008 we added six new 1500-barrel fermentation tanks that increased our capacity to 450,000 barrels per year, and added a new keg filling line capable of filling 300 kegs per hour.

data.name: Helles
data.description: A light golden colored German lager that balances the supremely subtle malt and hop flavors with a firm smoked undertone. Using German barley smoked traditionally during the kilning process, we employ a decoction mash to bring forth the malt character. Noble Hallertau Mittelfruh hops flower alongside the smokey aroma to create a very refreshing and special harmony.

style.name: Bamberg-Style Helles Rauchbier
style.description: Helles Rauchbier should have beech wood smoky characters that range from detectable to prevalent in the aroma and flavor. Smoke character is not harshly phenolic, but rather very smooth, almost rendering a perception of mild sweetness to this style of beer. This is a medium-bodied, smoke and malt-emphasized beer, with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). This beer should be perceived as having low bitterness. Certain renditions of this beer style approach a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. Helles Rauchbier malt character is reminiscent of freshly and very lightly toasted sweet malted barley. There should not be any caramel character. Color is light straw to golden. Noble-type hop flavor is low but may be perceptible. The aroma should strike a balance between malt, hop, and smoke. Fruity esters, diacetyl, and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Live Oak Brewing Company
breweries.description: Live Oak Brewing Company is truly a home-grown Austin enterprise. Two of Austin's own homebrews, Chip McElroy and Brian Peters, literally hand-built the brewery and were the two main brewers, keg washers, delivery persons, and proselytizers. Live Oak has grown since then, but we are still just as passionate about providing delicious old-world style beers that are rarely commercially available. Our special beers are brewed in limited quantities in a small east Austin brewery and are available in fine pubs and restaurants in Austin, Dallas, Houston, Alpine, Marathon, San Marcos and San Antonio.

style.name: Specialty Beer
style.description: These beers are brewed using unusual fermentable sugars, grains and starches that contribute to alcohol content other than, or in addition to, malted barley. Nuts generally have some degree of fermentables, thus beers brewed with nuts would appropriately be entered in this category. The distinctive characters of these special ingredients should be evident either in the aroma, flavor or overall balance of the beer, but not necessarily in overpowering quantities. For example, maple syrup or potatoes would be considered unusual. Rice, corn, or wheat are not considered unusual. Special ingredients must be listed when competing. A statement by the brewer explaining the special nature of the beer, ingredient(s) and achieved character is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with some specialty ingredient(s), the brewer should also specify the classic style. Guidelines for competing: Spiced beers using unusual fermentables should be entered in the experimental category. Fruit beers using unusual fermentables should be entered in the fruit beer category.

data.name: Helles
data.description: Our Helles beer (German for "Pale") is true to the German style.  It is dark gold in color with a balance between the malt sweetness & smooth hop bitterness.

breweries.name: Square One Brewery & Distillery
breweries.description: The Square One Brewery & Distillery began operations as a brewery /restaurant in February of 2006. In August of 2008 Square One became the first microdistillery restaurant in the state of Missouri and one of the first in the country. We believe that our approach to the alcohol beverage program is unique and very different from that of other restaurants. We believe in crafting the products we serve whether it is spirits, beer or food. By combining the expertise of our distiller, our master brewer, and our chef we are committed to creating an amazing array of flavors and tastes for our customers.

data.name: Helles
data.description:
Maxlrainer Helles is a classic Bavarian beer variety brewed from finest ingredients, exquisite, aromatic and fresh to the taste, golden-yellow in color and topped with a superbly persistent head.
It goes without saying that this traditional beer is brewed in strict conformity with the Bavarian Purity Law. It ranks among the many Maxlrain beers that never fail to qualify for the DLG Gold Medal awarded each year. Maxlrain Helles is dedicated to Max Veit, Earl of Maxlrain (1677-1734), the last of his house, whose portrait adorns the captivating gold-green label.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Schlossbrauerei Maxlrain
breweries.description: Schlossbrauerei Maxlrain is first mentioned in 1636. It was a “brown beer” brewery as was customary in those times. While a great deal has changed in the meantime, essential features have survived. Thus, Maxlrain is and remains a local private brewery under independent management. The fifteen styles of beer classified under pale ale, dark ale, Pils or wheat beer are all brewed applying manual skills utilizing finest ingredients enhanced by our own source of spring water drawn from the Mangfall Valley.

breweries.name: Hall Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We are a traditional farmhouse brewery based in Parker, Colorado. Everything we do–from building our brewery to making the beer–we do with our own hands. We make true craft beer. We take pride in not only producing the best craft beer but also putting enough in it to suit our custom four-thousand-square-foot building we made from Colorado beetle-kill pine. That means big, ornate beer. And why not? The best isn’t always for everyone!

We are a family-owned business. Under the guidance of master brewer and construction engineer Aubrey Hall, our family has pulled together to make something special.

breweries.name: BRLO
breweries.description:
We make handcrafted beers in small batches, rich in character and passion. We are also super proud of our really strange name: BRLO is the slavic origin of the name Berlin.

Currently building a taproom, restaurant, and 20HL brewery in the heart of Berlin- Opening December 2016.

data.name: Helles
data.description: Helles - Our take on this classic Munich lager is brewed with Hallertau hops, German pilsner malt, and soft New York City tap water. Our Helles is a testament to precisely balanced, high-quality raw materials. Fermented long and cold with our house lager yeast, this Helles offers a crackery malt backbone and restrained bitterness. (4.5% ABV)

data.name: Helles
data.description: Helles is the lightest of the German lagers. Saddlebock Helles is a smooth-drinking beer, with a crisp, mild malt-accented flavor, and a very light, lingering hops note.

breweries.name: Saddlebock Brewery
breweries.description: Welcome to Saddlebock Brewery - the first production brewery in Northwest Arkansas. Since 2012, we've been brewing fine, European-style beers in an environmentally friendly facility. Saddlebock Brewery was named by Yahoo Travel as one of the coolest craft brewery tours in America, and Steve Rehbock, our founder, was recognized this year as an Arkansas Eco-Hero.

breweries.name: Ruddy Duck Brewery and Grill
breweries.description:
Our philosophy is simple:
Create a fun and exciting atmosphere
Serve authentic made from scratch food
Provide gracious and hospitable service
Deliver it all at a great value

To guarantee excellence we buy the highest quality ingredients and prepare them to bring out the best flavors in every dish. Our chicken wings are cooked fresh daily to ensure our signature taste. Fresh and never frozen chicken breast, pork, mahi and salmon are delivered daily.

We buy only grass fed "all natural" steaks and hamburgers to ensure the highest quality. We support local farmers by purchasing our seafood and produce locally whenever available. Our desserts, pizza dough, and house specialty "Chipas" are made daily from scratch as are all our sauces, dressings and soups.

We promote friendly, unobtrusive service delivered with a smile. Most important to us is you, our guests. We strive to be a neighborhood restaurant where families with children, professionals on business, or couples out on a date can all feel welcome and comfortable.

data.name: Helles
data.description: An unfiltered and dry hopped craft beer. Brewed of best organic hop and barley malt from Hallertau. Elegantly dry, tasty and with citrus notes. A bottle of clear water from the spring of the Isar is added to every brew batch.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: English-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: Most traditional interpretations of English-style India pale ales are characterized by medium-high hop bitterness with a medium to medium-high alcohol content. Hops from a variety of origins may be used to contribute to a high hopping rate. Earthy and herbal English-variety hop character is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer, sometimes with subtle and balanced character of sulfur compounds. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a medium to high, flowery hop aroma and may have a medium to strong hop flavor (in addition to the hop bitterness). English-style India pale ales possess medium maltiness and body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional English character.

data.description:
A golden, Munich-style lager. The accent is on the malt character. Medium-bodied, smooth, with just enough hops to keep everything in balance.

Silver Medal Winner at the 2005 LA County Fair

breweries.name: Taps Fish House & Brewery
breweries.description:
TAPS Fish House & Brewery was founded in 1999. Many of our beers reflect the classic brewing traditions of Europe, including England, Germany, and Belgium, while others are indicative of the creativity and innovation that are the hallmarks of the American Craft Beer scene.

TAPS’ repertoire of ales and lagers is highly varied and reflects a nod to tradition with a focus on perfection and innovation. The brewing team produces approximately 3000 kegs, or 46,500 gallons of beer annually. Our brewers supply TAPS in Brea, Corona and Irvine, as well as our sister restaurants, The Catch in Anaheim and Lillie’s Q in Brea Downtown. TAPS also distributes fine beers to restaurants and pubs throughout Southern California. We have received national and international acclaim for barrel-aging programs, which produce cult classics such as Remy’s Pappy.

We source the finest ingredients from around the world and utilize the best brewing procedures to create truly great beer: “World Class in Every Glass.” The hops and barley are meticulously sourced in order to emulate the fine beers and brewing regions of the world.  We utilize proprietary strains of yeast, reverse osmosis filtration, and tailor our water chemistry and processes every time beer is made.

TAPS’ passion for perfection has been recognized on the regional, state, national and international levels—to date we have received over 87 medals for our fine beers. TAPS barrel-aged products have also garnered national and international acclaim and are treasured by collectors worldwide

data.name: Helles - Vollbier
data.description: This beautifully delicate lager is simply - and only created with the highest quality Organic German Pils and Mittelfruh hops. A double decoction mash takes single malted lager to a height of malt complexity. The hop character sublimely balances the palate, while the carbonation is 100% natural, resulting in a most drinkable lagerbier.

We only use the finest certified organic ingredients the Pacific Northwest has to offer, creating some of the cleanest and most unique brews in the market today. Truly dank brew; Pride of the Organic Northwest.

breweries.name: Biercamp
breweries.description: Seasonal varieties of artisan sausage, bratwurst, hot dogs, jerky, bacon, pickled items, nano brews and more hand made fresh in-house.

data.name: Helles and Back
data.description: A golden lager in the traditional Munich brewing style. This is what you find on tap in Bavaria instead of a Pilsener. With more malt character and less hop bitterness than a pilsener. Our unfiltered Helles was brewed with traditional Bohemian malt and German Noble hops.

style.name: American-Style Lager
style.description: Light in body and very light to straw in color, American lagers are very clean and crisp and aggressively carbonated. Flavor components should b e subtle and complex, with no one ingredient dominating the others. Malt sweetness is light to mild. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts are often used. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are negligible to very light. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Lost Rhino Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Lost Rhino™ is a new craft brewery in Ashburn, VA with deep roots in Loudoun County. Brewers Matt Hagerman and Favio Garcia, formerly of Old Dominion, are back together and now creating some of the finest beers found in the local area!

The name Lost Rhino™ represents the strength and attitude of the rhinoceros. The five species of rhino each has its own distinct persona, ranging from laid back to aggressive. Our brews will also span a range of personalities from hoppy Pilsners to rich, malty IPAs.

"Rhino chasers" are big wave surfers on a continuous journey to find the next perfect wave. At Lost Rhino™, we are on a similar journey to create a continuing line of distinctive, enjoyable, memorable beers.

data.name: Helles Angel
data.description: 2016 BEST OF CRAFT BEER AWARDS GOLD MEDAL WINNER! Helles is German for "light". Lucifer is the angel of light. Coincidence? Yeah, but it makes for a great beer name. This Helles lager is very low on hop bitterness, but packed full of sweet, bready malt flavor making this a sessionable, full-bodied lager for any time of year.

style.description: This beer should be perceived as having low bitterness. It is a medium-bodied, malt-emphasized beer with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). Certain renditions of this beer style have  a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. Malt character is sometimes bread-like yet always reminiscent of freshly and very lightly toasted malted barley. There should not be any caramel character. Color is light straw to golden. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze.

style.name: American-Style Lager
style.description: Light in body and very light to straw in color, American lagers are very clean and crisp and aggressively carbonated. Flavor components should b e subtle and complex, with no one ingredient dominating the others. Malt sweetness is light to mild. Corn, rice, or other grain or sugar adjuncts are often used. Hop bitterness, flavor and aroma are negligible to very light. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Edenton Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Previously Chesapeake Bay Brewing.

Opened in 2003 by Brian Baker, who relocated to Raleigh from Edenton, NC rather than suffer the massive expense of moving ChesBay's brewing equipment to his building in Edenton, especially considering the local Raleigh customer base that was already in place after the demise of ChesBay.

In 2007, Baker sold the business to Geoff Lamb, who ultimately renamed the brewery after Edenton's most-popular label.

data.name: Helles Awaits
data.description: A light but full flavored malty lager. Perfect for the craft beer lover as the weather gets warmer.

style.name: Münchner (Munich)-Style Helles
style.description: This beer should be perceived as having low bitterness. It is a medium-bodied, malt-emphasized beer with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). Certain renditions of this beer style have  a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. Malt character is sometimes bread-like yet always reminiscent of freshly and very lightly toasted malted barley. There should not be any caramel character. Color is light straw to golden. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze.

breweries.name: Devil's Kettle Brewing
breweries.description:
Devil's Kettle Brewing is a microbrewery in Athens, Ohio. We opened in June of 2015, making us the second oldest brewery in Athens!

 Like many of today's best microbreweries, the origins of Devil's Kettle go back to a kitchen stovetop, with some pots and buckets. Brewmaster Cameron Fuller grew up around winemaking, but when he reached college, his interests shifted towards beer. Unlike most undergrads, Fuller had a passion for craft beers, but affordability was an issue for a college student. He decided to teach himself how to make his own beer with just the help of the internet and some of his family's old winemaking equipment. Not surprisingly, the early beers were less than desirable, but a fire was lit.

 For the next 8 years, Fuller focused on perfecting his craft. The beers got better and the reviews were great, but how true is the praise from people who are given free beer? In 2013, Fuller entered a number of his beers in the Ohio Brew Week homebrew competition to get some unbiased feedback, with the mindset that if he did "well enough", then he would consider going pro. Well, "good enough" was never in question. He won the most medals in the competition and Best in Show. Not only was the path to professional brewing before him, he was practically being pushed down it.

​The next 2 years comprised of financing, finding a location, and developing it to become a brewery. A lot of hard work paid off and we were able to open with a world class brew system, a gorgeous taproom, and an eviable amount of space to grow and improve our operations. We couldn't be happier with what we have and we can't wait to share it with you!

​

data.name: Helles Belles
data.description: A straw blond lager brewed with 100% Vienna malts and German Tettnang hops. Subtle malt flavor with a crisp dry finish.

style.name: Münchner (Munich)-Style Helles

breweries.name: Columbus Brewing Company
breweries.description: We are dedicated to exploring the flavors of American hops, subtleties of German-style lagers, the intensity of barrel-aged beers & everything in between.

data.name: Helles Belles
data.description: Helles Belles is a traditional German-style lager brewed with premium pilsner malt and bittered with Hallertau hops. Originally brewed for the Oregon Brewers Festival, Helles — meaning light — is straw yellow in color, bright, and crisp. So for those about to rock, Ninkasi proudly presents Helles Belles!

style.name: Münchner (Munich)-Style Helles
style.description: This beer should be perceived as having low bitterness. It is a medium-bodied, malt-emphasized beer with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). breweries.name: Ninkasi Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Established in 2006 by Jamie Floyd and Nikos Ridge, Ninkasi Brewing Company continues to brew independent craft beer from its Pacific Northwest home base in Eugene, Oregon. Named after the Sumerian Goddess of fermentation, the brewery operates under the core purpose: Perpetuate Better Living. Known for beers like Total Domination IPA, Tricerahops Double IPA, Dawn of the Red IRA, and cult favorites like Sleigh'r and Maiden the Shade, Ninkasi proudly serves quality craft beers while focusing on community involvement, art and culture. 

Learn more at www.ninkasibrewing.com.

hops.name: Hallertauer (American)
hops.description: Small quantities of the true Hallertauer Mittelfr?her cultivar are grown in the United States. However, just as with other Hallertauer hop varieties, it can be difficult to know what exactly you are getting; Hallertauer Gold, Mount Hood, and Liberty, among others, are sometimes sold as "U.S. Hallertauer". Even the true Hallertauer Mittelfr?her is not considered to have a true noble hop quality when grown in the United States.

malt.name: Two-Row Pale Malt
malt.description: The is the standard starting point for almost all beer recipes. Smooth with a less grainy more moderate flavour.

malt.name: Vienna Malt
malt.description: Vienna Malt is a kiln-dried barley malt darker than pale ale malt, but not as dark as Munich Malt. It imparts a golden to orange color and a distinctive toast or biscuit malt aroma to the beer.

style.name: Ordinary Bitter
style.description: Ordinary bitter is gold to copper colored with medium bitterness, light to medium body, and low to medium residual malt sweetness. Hop flavor and aroma character may be evident at the brewer's discretion. Mild carbonation traditionally characterizes draft-cask versions, but in bottled versions, a slight increase in carbon dioxide content is acceptable. Fruity-ester character and very low diacetyl (butterscotch) character are acceptable in aroma and flavor, but should be minimized in this form of bitter. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and American hop character may be specified in subcategories.)

style.name: Traditional German-Style Bock
style.description: Traditional bocks are made with all malt and are strong, malty, medium- to full-bodied, bottom-fermented beers with moderate hop bitterness that should increase proportionately with the starting gravity. Malt character should be a balance of sweetness and toasted/nut-like malt; not caramel. Hop flavor should be low and hop aroma should be very low. Bocks can range in color from deep copper to dark brown. Fruity esters should be minimal. Diacetyl should be absent.

breweries.name: Wooden Cask Brewing Company
breweries.description: A Micro Brewery in the heart of Newport Kentucky’s Historic Neighborhoods, we put a lot of craft and love into what we do. Made from superior ingredients, we believe you deserve a well-crafted more flavorful beer.

style.name: German-Style Heller Bock/Maibock
style.description: The German word helle means light colored, and as such, a heller Bock is light straw to deep golden in color. Maibocks are also light-colored bocks. The sweet malty character should come through in the aroma and flavor. A lightly toasted and/or bready malt character is often evident. Roast or heavy toast/caramel malt character should be absent. Body is medium to full. Hop bitterness should be low, while noble-type hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Bitterness increases with gravity. Fruity esters may be perceived at low levels. Diacetyl should be absent. Chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Beaver Street Brewery
breweries.description: You can watch the chefs create your meal in our open kitchen or view the brewer creating our handcrafted ales and lagers behind the bar.

data.name: Helles Bock
data.description: A German-styled lager. It is brewed using a multi-step mashing procedure. It is deep gold/light amber in color. The malty aroma and flavor is balanced by spiciness from noble hops and alcohol.

style.name: German-Style Heller Bock/Maibock
style.description: The German word helle means light colored, and as such, a heller Bock is light straw to deep golden in color. Maibocks are also light-colored bocks. The sweet malty character should come through in the aroma and flavor. A lightly toasted and/or bready malt character is often evident. Roast or heavy toast/caramel malt character should be absent. Body is medium to full. Hop bitterness should be low, while noble-type hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Bitterness increases with gravity. Fruity esters may be perceived at low levels. Diacetyl should be absent. Chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Turoni's Main Street Brewery
breweries.description:
Turoni's Pizzery & Brewery takes great pride in serving you, and we thank you. We are dedicated to warm and friendly service to our guests by employees who give a damn. We pledge to provide the best products at the best value. If we are not proud of it we WILL NOT serve it!

Turoni's pizza has been made in Evansville for over three decades, yet never before has the recipe been reproduced by commercial establishments because of the difficulties involved in preparation.

Turoni's has been able to overcome these difficulties to share with you a freshly made pizza crust that is crisp and light enough to hold our secret sauce, gobs of gooey mozzarella cheese, and your favorite ingredients (including a few exotic ones) to make what we call "Our Specialty", Turoni's thin crust pizza. This flavor and texture makes Turoni's pizza very unique.

data.name: Helles Bock

breweries.name: Trinity Brewhouse
breweries.description:
Always fresh, always crisp.
Crafted with the finest quality hops from around the world, and filtered Scituate Reservoir water from right here in Little Rhody.

The beers, ales, porters and stouts available at the Brewhouse Pub are brewed on premises - ensuring a high quality product that is always satisfying and never flat.

Our Brewmaster takes great pride in providing our customers with the freshest beer in the city.
If we were any fresher...you'd slap us!

Stop by for a pint or two in house - or grab a Growler To Go and enjoy great Trinity Brewhouse Beer at your own leisure.

data.name: Helles Bock
data.description: Our Helles Bock style lager is deep gold in colour with a grainy-sweet malt aroma. This traditional German style lager has bready malt flavours upfront and a mild noble hop finish. Helles Bock is light in colour yet big on flavour!

style.name: German-Style Heller Bock/Maibock
style.description: The German word helle means light colored, and as such, a heller Bock is light straw to deep golden in color. Maibocks are also light-colored bocks. The sweet malty character should come through in the aroma and flavor. A lightly toasted and/or bready malt character is often evident. Roast or heavy toast/caramel malt character should be absent. Body is medium to full. Hop bitterness should be low, while noble-type hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Bitterness increases with gravity. Fruity esters may be perceived at low levels. Diacetyl should be absent. Chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Wellington Brewery
breweries.description:
Wellington Brewery in Guelph has brewed its fine ales and lagers since 1985. The brewery's architecture imitates that of a traditional 'oast house,' a building once built especially for drying and packing hops, a key ingredient in Wellington's select recipes. The brewery, named after the first Duke of Wellington, uses natural ingredients and patient brewing methods to produce ales of timeless distinction, not unlike the Duke himself. 
Wellington Brewery is proud to be celebrating 25 years of craft brewing in 2010. Please visit our website to find out all the exciting things we will be doing this year to celebrate our 25th Anniversary!

style.name: Ordinary Bitter
style.description: Ordinary bitter is gold to copper colored with medium bitterness, light to medium body, and low to medium residual malt sweetness. Hop flavor and aroma character may be evident at the brewer's discretion. Mild carbonation traditionally characterizes draft-cask versions, but in bottled versions, a slight increase in carbon dioxide content is acceptable. Fruity-ester character and very low diacetyl (butterscotch) character are acceptable in aroma and flavor, but should be minimized in this form of bitter. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and American hop character may be specified in subcategories.)

breweries.name: Sly Fox Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Sly Fox Brewing Company is a family owned and operated independent craft brewery that started humbly in 1995 and has grown to include distribution in multiple states.
Sly Fox beers were among the first craft beers available in cans – the best container for climbers, kayakers, cyclists, runners, and anyone who loves the outdoor lifestyle and quality beer. The Outdoor Enthusiast’s Choice, Sly Fox remains committed to supporting opportunities for craft beer and adventure to coexist.
Sly Fox Brewing Company is as independent and local as breweries come—the archetype maker, focused on the qualitative experience great beers deliver.
As a devoted local business, Sly Fox is dedicated to contributing to the worthwhile efforts that make our hometowns of Phoenixville and Pottstown unique and vibrant Pennsylvanian communities.

breweries.name: Yazoo Brewing Company
breweries.description: Yazoo Brewing began as just a dream, stoked by years of homebrewing in the basement. Linus and Lila Hall moved to Nashville from Mississippi in 1996, with Linus going to work as a tire engineer for Bridgestone and Lila as a curator for the Parthenon. Trying to make tires more round proved to be less fulfilling than making great beer, so with the encouragement of Lila, Linus quit his job, got a business degree from Vanderbilt and a craft-brewing education through a course at the American Brewer's Guild, and did an internship under Garrett Oliver at Brooklyn Brewery. Linus found a used 10 bbl brewing system from a brewpub in Iowa that had gone out of business, and went to work restoring a corner of the old Marathon Motorworks building for their brewery. Yazoo Brewing opened for business in Oct 2003, and quickly gained an enthusiastic local following.

data.name: Helles Brook Lager
data.description: Golden hue, clean and crisp with a gentle yeast nose, light bitterness on the finish.

breweries.name: Idletyme Brewing Company
breweries.description:
SIMPLE & SEASONAL

Once in awhile a place comes along that offers everything you want in a dining experience: quality beer brewed on site, delicious, high-value fare that's family friendly and a cool atmosphere where locals and tourists alike can relax, share stories and soak up almost two centuries of history. You’ve found that place. Welcome to the Idletyme Brewing Company in Stowe, Vermont.

breweries.name: Crop Bistro & Brewery
breweries.description:
Crop believes in simplicity…..

We believe food is at its most flavorful, its most creative, its most passionate, when it’s at its freshest.

We believe food is at its best when it highlights the care and craftsmanship of those who bring it from the field to your plate.

We believe food is community, a series of connections between farmers and chefs and guests.

Seasonal, local flavors, hand-crafted ales and inventive libations, lovingly prepared and cheerfully served…Come and share the bounty of Crop.

data.description: Pale coloerd, light bodied summer lager brewed in the traditional German style. Hopped for balance with German noble varieties, this is a great session beer.

breweries.name: Anacortes Brewery
breweries.description: Our brewers focus on high quality ingredients, a carefully controlled process and delicate handling to provide one of the best beers you will find in the industry. We operate a seven barrel brewery designed and installed by Sound Brewing Systems of Seattle with vessels fabricated by Ripley Stainless in British Columbia. Our brewery features a cold room specially designed for lagering to provide our beers with a traditional character and complexity.

breweries.name: MobCraft Beer
breweries.description:
At our Milwaukee taproom we offer our flagships, crowdsourced beers and a variety of taproom only releases. The spacious taproom boasts views of our brewhouse and wild & sour room, as well as foosball, ping pong, live music, outdoor seating and much more!

We offer a wide variety of craft beers. Including our flagships, crowdsourced beers, releases from our Wild & Sour Program as well as limited taproom releases!

data.name: Helles Golden Lager
data.description:
A German-style golden lager brewed with imported German Pils malt and Saaz and Hallertauer hops. This light-bodied beer offers a gentle, dry finish. A perennial favorite in the Sly Fox pubs and our brewer's go-to session beer. Helles Golden Lager in a can offers wide open flavor and aroma.
Bronze Medal, GABF 2002.

We only use the finest certified organic ingredients the Pacific Northwest has to offer, creating some of the cleanest and most unique brews in the market today. Truly dank brew; Pride of the Organic Northwest.

data.description: A light lager, crafted with Pilsner malt, Mt. Hood hops, and Bavarian lager yeast. Malt sweetness and classic lager yeast flavor shine through in this simple, easy-drinking beer.

breweries.name: 13 Virtues Brewing Co
breweries.description:
We are a three-barrel brew house born from the shadows of long tenured Portland restaurant, Philadelphia’s Steaks & Hoagies. The brewery addition was added back in 1994 but operated quietly as Oregon’s smallest micobrewery for many years. With the more recent additions of David Vohden and Cameron Moore, we have refocused our efforts on producing and sharing a constantly changing lineup of fresh quality beers from right here in the Great Pacific Northwest. Vohden oversees all brewery operations which he has met with great success. Most recently of which was a Silver Medal for our Woozy Weizenbock at the Great American Beer Festival. We see our recent efforts bringing exciting results.

We reached completion of a 3,500 sq ft. addition to expand our brew house in the Summer of 2013. Vohden and Moore finished installation of the glycol system just in time to quench the thirsty demands of the 2013 Oregon Brewers Festival with a crowd pleasing Traverse Cherry Wit Bier. In addition to the brew house expansion we have added four 7-barrel fermentation tanks for an eventual all around 7-barrel system upgrade. A Cellar was also added for barrel aging, sours, and other delectable experiments.

Although most of the square footage was utilized for brewing purposes. We were sure to save some space for all you beer drinkers. A mezzanine gives an elevated view down onto the open brewery floor. If you happen to drop by on a brew day you too can enjoy the sweet sensory overload and watch the action (or lack thereof). A beautiful black walnut bar, fully stocked with 13 drafts faucets was added to accompany the additional seating area and to cater to private events. However, the new bar and brewery seating are always open to patrons except in the case of private events. Another 60′ TV was added to the new mezzanine area and we continue to play all major sporting events. Go Blazers!

Some would say our legendary steak sandwiches and two dozen rotating taps are a match made in heaven. Please join us and stop by to see what’s new!

data.name: Helles Hefe Weizen
data.description: Tucher Helles Hefeweizen is a traditional Bavarian wheat beer. Brewed according to centuries of tradition, this is the rime example of a Hefeweizen.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: South German-Style Hefeweizen / Hefeweissbier
style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. Because yeast is present, the beer will have yeast flavor and a characteristically fuller mouthfeel and may be appropriately very cloudy. No diacetyl should be perceived.

style.name: Ordinary Bitter
style.description: Ordinary bitter is gold to copper colored with medium bitterness, light to medium body, and low to medium residual malt sweetness. Hop flavor and aroma character may be evident at the brewer's discretion. Mild carbonation traditionally characterizes draft-cask versions, but in bottled versions, a slight increase in carbon dioxide content is acceptable. Fruity-ester character and very low diacetyl (butterscotch) character are acceptable in aroma and flavor, but should be minimized in this form of bitter. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and American hop character may be specified in subcategories.)

data.name: Helles Honey Maibock
data.description: Strong, bold and traditionally unique! German imported Pilsen malt is used to create this deep golden, seasonal style. Noble hops and California Amber honey are added for balance and flavor. 6.75% Volume

style.name: German-Style Heller Bock/Maibock
style.description: The German word helle means light colored, and as such, a heller Bock is light straw to deep golden in color. Maibocks are also light-colored bocks. The sweet malty character should come through in the aroma and flavor. A lightly toasted and/or bready malt character is often evident. Roast or heavy toast/caramel malt character should be absent. Body is medium to full. Hop bitterness should be low, while noble-type hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Bitterness increases with gravity. Fruity esters may be perceived at low levels. Diacetyl should be absent. Chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Third Street Aleworks Restaurant & Brewery
breweries.description: The Third Street AleWorks’ philosophy about beer and brewing is simple – use the best ingredients possible; never cut corners; and keep it fresh!

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Sunday-Thursday: 11:30 AM - Midnight
Friday-Saturday:  11:30 AM - 1:00 AM
locations.hoursOfOperationNotes:
Sunday-Thursday: 11:30 AM - Midnight
Friday-Saturday:  11:30 AM - 1:00 AM

data.name: Helles in Wonderland
data.description: Munich-style pale lager

style.name: Münchner (Munich)-Style Helles
style.description: This beer should be perceived as having low bitterness. It is a medium-bodied, malt-emphasized beer with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). Certain renditions of this beer style have  a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. Malt character is sometimes bread-like yet always reminiscent of freshly and very lightly toasted malted barley. There should not be any caramel character. Color is light straw to golden. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze.

breweries.name: Jessup Farm Barrel House
breweries.description:
Jessup Farm Barrel House is founded on having fun and letting our creativity explore the myriad of possibilities blending beer has to offer. By blending beers with different fermentation variations we are able to create unique and original flavors. Our goal is to take the robust characteristics from the barrels, and blend to bring out the complexities and delicacy of the flavors.

The Barrel House has a 16-tap selection of various blends. Beer is served in pints, flights and growlers. Growlers are filled with a counter pressure growler filler, to ensure proper carbonation and extend the longevity of the beer.

data.name: Helles Lager
data.description: A traditional German style Helles Lager utilizing German Lager yeast, floor malted Pilsner malt and Northwest grown Liberty hops. We lagered Helles Canyon for a month and a half prior to release, creating a crisp and clean, straw-colored Lager, with an emphasis on malt & hop balance.

style.name: Vienna-Style Lager
style.description: Beers in this category are reddish brown or copper colored. They are medium in body. The beer is characterized by malty aroma and slight malt sweetness. The malt aroma and flavor should have a notable degree of toasted and/or slightly roasted malt character. Hop bitterness is clean and crisp. Noble-type hop aromas and flavors should be low or mild. Diacetyl, chill haze and ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Three Creeks Brewing
breweries.description: Where we utilize only the finest ingredients available for all of our food and brewing activities, while striving to impress even the most sensitive of palates, Our menu of excellent yet casual and unpretentious pub food is served in a family-friendly, smoke-free environment that all patrons will enjoy. Our old west livery stable provides a comfortable, warm and rustic atmosphere that includes a full restaurant, 10 barrel brewing system, comfortable bar area complete with large screen TV’s and pool tables as well as a large patio for the enjoyment of our hand crafted ales.

data.name: Helles Lager
data.description: A full-bodied, golden, Southern German lager. Balanced malt sweetness with slight breadiness shows off a mix of delicate noble hop flavors and aromas.

style.name: Münchner (Munich)-Style Helles
style.description: This beer should be perceived as having low bitterness. It is a medium-bodied, malt-emphasized beer with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). Certain renditions of this beer style have  a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. Malt character is sometimes bread-like yet always reminiscent of freshly and very lightly toasted malted barley. There should not be any caramel character. Color is light straw to golden. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze.

breweries.name: Rosenstadt Brewery
breweries.description: Founders Nick Greiner and Tobias Hahn bring a love of German beer and culture to the Northwest with Rosenstadt Brewery. #rosenstadtbeer
